etymologies: early 19th century: from French, from se mirer ‘be reflected’, from Latin mirare ‘look at’

definitions: an optical illusion caused by atmospheric conditions, especially the appearance of a sheet of water in a desert or on a hot road caused by the refraction of light from the sky by heated air

examples.text: the surface of the road ahead rippled in the heat mirages

shortDefinitions: optical illusion caused by atmospheric conditions

definitions: something that appears real or possible but is not in fact so

examples.text: the notion that the public is pro-business is a mirage

shortDefinitions: unrealistic hope or wish that cannot be achieved
